title: 1 bedroom mews property for rent
description: The Sex Pistols lived, recorded and rehearsed in this mews house behind No. 6 Denmark Street. Originally intended for Badfinger, the mews house hosted countless sessions - including one that saw Johnny Rotten take to the walls to etch the Pistol’s own mark on the street, drawing caricatures of himself and fellow band mates. Here they’d record demos for two of their tracks ‘Anarchy in the UK’ and ‘Pretty Vacant’. <PARA> Set back and with its own private courtyard, this Signature Apartment allows guests to sleep in a little piece of history. A duplex mews house, it is the epitome of punk prowess and versatility, complete with tartan and sheer roman blinds along with statement upholstered graffitied chairs. <PARA> In true punk rock spirit, the apartment has been reimagined with the living space upstairs where Johnny Rotten’s storied caricatures comfortably reside. Complete with kitchenette maxi-bar, bold furniture designs pay direct homage to the building's history, while the bedroom downstairs features a black Murphy bed, flanked by marbled moulin noir bedsides. In addition, a brazen reimagining of vintage chairs – modernised for both their time and this place. Wrapping almost the entire room, the hand drawn caricatures by John Lydon, aka Johnny Rotten, led to the building being upgraded from Grade II to the prestigious Grade II* listed status by Historic England. This, somewhat rightly, conveniently coincided with Punk’s 40th Anniversary as they were deemed as important an archeological find as prehistoric cave paintings. In addition to all of the original architectural details there's also a replica of Steve Jones' Les Paul hanging all the wall. <PARA> While a 65-inch screen complements the sound system, courtesy of world-respected audio manufacturers Void and Artcoustic, touching the imagination of similar spirited music lovers. Statement bathrooms feature a large walk-in shower with marbled floor meeting deep forest green tiles. While bronze and brass finishes across taps, faucets and shower heads make for a classic aesthetic rooted in contemporary style. <PARA> Opened in February 2022, Chateau Denmark is located 200 yards from the Dominion Theatre and 200 yards from Prince Edward Theatre. <PARA> It provides air-conditioned accommodation with views of the city and free WiFi and each room has a dedicated butler who is always on hand a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom with bathrobes, slippers and shower. Some units include a seating area and/or a patio. <PARA> Located in a neighbourhood steeped in cultural heritage and long established as the entertainment district of London with fashionable upmarket restaurants, theatres, night life, film industry and China Town nestled amongst a vibrant residential area, it is diverse and charming. <PARA> Popular points of interest near Chateau Denmark include Arts Theatre, Queen's Theatre and British Museum. <PARA> The nearest airport is London City Airport, 7.5 miles from the accommodation. <PARA> Copper broadband

The apartment of 2960 sq ft comprises three double bedroom suites, three en-suite bathrooms, a large reception room with a separate dining room, cinema room and cloakroom and a utility room and has been finished with the highest quality interiors. <PARA> The Corinthia Private Residences are located in the heart of the political establishment at 10 Whitehall Place and the apartment comes with underground car parking and a 4 cubic metre storage unit. After more than a century and an illustrious history as a ministerial HQ, the buildings interiors were totally transformed in 2016. The elegant façade and proportions remain along with its elegantly arched bridge over Scotland Place and its impressive edifice that has been described as ‘classical public architecture with Italianate elements. <PARA> This apartment has voluminous space and uncompromising quality and has been interior designed for exquisite luxury living and elegant entertaining. From the private fourth floor lift lobby, residents are invited into a spacious entrance foyer with marble flooring and wood surround. <PARA> The inner hall leads to an ornate and very generous and well-proportioned reception room with fumed oak floors and a gas fireplace. The reception room leads onto a separate and intimate 10-seater dining room before reaching the designer kitchen with Walnut veneered cupboards and Gaggenau appliances, as well as a utility room with a service entrance. <PARA> The generous master bedroom has a walk-in dressing room with two ranges of built-in cupboards and a polished and sealed Calacatta Oro marble in the en-suite bathroom, which benefits from twin basins, a separate bath and shower and a toilet. <PARA> The second and third bedrooms also benefit from a built-in wardrobe and a marble-clad en-suite with a separate bath and shower. <PARA> The apartment also has state-of-the-art home entertainment and security systems, as well as lighting, heating and window blinds which can be controlled remotely. The hotel spa is arranged over four floors with an indoor vitality pool, swimming pool, amphitheatre sauna, ice fountain, private sleep pods and 17 treatment rooms and also boasts an outpost of stylist-to-the-stars Daniel Galvinss famous hair salons. Surrounded by minimalist white couches, the stainless steel swimming pool has been sunk into a mould of black marble. <PARA> With endless dining options along with Michelin-starred chefs, a string of cocktail bars, a humidor room, an in-house florist (Ercole Moroni) and panoramic terraces, residents can truly indulge. <PARA> Located on one of the most prestigious streets in London, Whitehall Place, The Corinthia Residences are moments away from the Houses of Parliament, Buckingham Palace, St James Park, Downing Street and the banks of the River Thames, along with easy access to an abundance of galleries including the National Gallery and Royal Academy and the theatres, shops and restaurants of the West End which are all a short walk away. <PARA> Perfectly positioned between St Jamess and Covent Garden, between Westminster and the West End, the transport links include Embankment Tube Station (Northern, Bakerloo, Circle and District lines), and Charing Cross and Waterloo stations.
